page.title: 18BARGEDDIE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: It was{Bargeddie Primary's 90th {Anniversary}in{1984.}During these years there have been{four Coronations The{first}in{1902}for{Edward VII}was recorded in the{School Log Book.}The girls wore red cowls and the boys red} caps with a portrait of the King and Queen on them. Owing to the King's ill _ness the Coronation was postponed, the children entertained in school and sent home early. In{June 1911 George Vth}was{crowned. {The school closed early}on the 21st and the pupils marched to Baillieston on the 22nd for celebrations.{ { On 12th May1937 King George VIth}the present{Queen's father}was crowned.The school children had{four hours work, {lunched in school and held a service {led by the Reverends Cameron and Derry {A box of sweets,a new penny,an ice and {two oranges were given to the pupils.
